content.description:
This is probably one of the best pitches in the canyon... if it was longer! Amazing rock and splitter features make up a classic for sure! Though KC gave it the grade of 5.11+, I feel this thing clocks in for those of average hand size (KC has some huge mitts) at 5.10.

The crux is getting off the ground, and it's just pleasureful jamming up and through a little roof. Once past the roof, you are hit with reality some peg-infused choss. Head up 5th class to the left or continue up a vein of peg to the right at 5.9 to some tat around a tree.
content.protection: Bring a few fingers and small hands pieces.
content.location: This is far left.  Keep walking until you see splitter clean rock! Start off a little ledge.

content.description: A bit flush with foliage, but good rock and a decent crack leads you up the first 80'. Below a roof traverse left to gain a second crack system. First Ascent Party went up the wide crack, I stayed on the incipient crack on the right side. This could be broken up into two pitches, but one long pitch is quiet fun and manageable. Two belay anchors are at the top.
content.protection:
Double set from fingers to #3 with one #4

Two bolt anchor at the top.
content.location: Middle of the wall. The long obvious crack that tackles the largest/tallest section of the wall.

content.description: This is a cool feature and takes you on an angling voyage across the wall. The rock quality is often sub-par and placements are less than inspiring. There are some interesting and cool lovements.
content.protection:
Double set up to #3 with nuts

Walk to Hummingbird to rappel.
content.location: Walk along the base of the wall up canyon (right of Hummingbird) until you are on a ledge and there is a pegmatite lined crack above you.

content.description: This is a good, steep route that offers some thoughtful climbing. It is pumpy and technical through the bottom and has some straight up hard jamming through the right-trending roof.
content.protection: Bring a few finger sizes and two #1s for up top. Build an anchor or find a tree up top.
content.location:
This is 20' right of

Jokers Wild

. It is a discontinuous crack that leads up to a hand size crack trending right.
